info.name: HOTEL API
info.description:
The **Hotel API** is a RESTful backend service that provides all the essential operations for managing users, authentication, hotel listings, rooms, and bookings within a hotel reservation platform. It is designed to be clean, scalable, and easy to integrate with any frontend — web, mobile, or third-party applications.

This API exposes well-structured versioned endpoints (`/v1`) and follows industry-standard authentication practices using **JWT tokens**. Both **regular users** and **administrators** can interact with the system, with permissions based on their roles.

## **Key Capabilities**

### **Authentication Flow**

- User registration & login
    
- Secure login using JWT-based tokens
    
- Token rotation via refresh tokens
    
- Role-based access (User/Admin)
    
- Logout endpoint for session control
    

### **User Capabilities**

- Fetch own profile details
    
- Update personal information
    
- Access hotel & room listings
    
- Create bookings and cancel existing ones
    

### **Admin Capabilities**

Admins have elevated permissions:

- Create/update/delete hotels
    
- Create/update/delete rooms
    
- Create new admins
    
- Delete users or downgrade admin accounts
    

### **Hotel & Room Management**

- Add new hotels
    
- Add rooms to hotels
    
- Update or delete existing hotels or rooms
    
- Fetch hotels and room details (public/user access)
    

### **Booking Management**

- Create a booking
    
- Cancel a booking
    
- Ensure availability & reservation workflow
    

---

## **Resource Groups**

### **1\. Auth**

Contains all authentication-related endpoints:

- Register
    
- Login
    
- Logout
    
- Rotate Token
    

### **2\. User**

Endpoints used by a regular authenticated user:

- Fetch own profile
    
- Update profile
    
- View hotel & room details
    
- Create & cancel bookings
    

### **3\. Admin**

Endpoints restricted to administrators:

- Manage users (delete/upgrade/downgrade)
    
- Create admin
    
- Manage hotels (create/update/delete)
    
- Manage rooms (create/update/delete)
    

### **4\. Test**

Contains the health-check or root endpoint:

- Server test route (`GET /`)
    

## **Base URLs**

You can switch between environments using Postman:

| Environment | URL |
| --- | --- |
| Production / Deployment | `{{url}}` |
| Local Development | `http://localhost:3000/api` |

---

## **Authentication Header**

Most endpoints require an Authorization header:

```
Authorization: Bearer <access_token>

 ```

Public endpoints like Registration, Login, and Hotel Listing do not require tokens.

---

## **Response Format**

The API returns consistent JSON responses:

### **Success Example**

``` json
{
  "message": "Operation successful",
  "data": { }
}

 ```

### **Error Example**

``` json
{
  "error": "Invalid credentials",
  "status": 401
}

 ```

## **Getting Started**

1. Register a user or admin
    
2. Log in to get an access token
    
3. Add the token to Postman under **Authorization → Bearer Token**
    
4. Start using the User/Admin features depending on your role

item.name: Admin Routes

request.description:
Deletes a user or admin account by ID.

id - should be UUID.

Converts a user account to an admin account.

id - should be UUID. (user id)

Converts a admin account to regular user account.

id - should be UUID. (user id)

response.name: Successful

request.description:
Creates a new admin account. Requires an existing admin token.

``` json
{
  "name": string,      // character length should be 2 to 100
  "email": string,
  "password": string   // Min - 1 upper, 1 lower, 1 numeric, 1 special character
}

 ```

Creates a new hotel entry. Only admins can access this.

``` json
{
    "name": string,      // (min: , max: 100)
    "location": string   // (min: , max: 100)  
}

 ```

Updates hotel details. Admin only. Fields are optional, editing only one works

id - should be UUID. (hotel id)

``` json
{
    "name": string,      // (min: , max: 100) Optional
    "location": string   // (min: , max: 100) Optional
}

 ```

Deletes a hotel. Admin only.

id - should be UUID. (Hotel id)

Adds a new room for the specified hotel.

id - should be UUID. (Hotel id)

``` json
{
    "room_number": string,
    "type": enum (string),  // allowed values - single, double, suite
    "price": string
}

 ```

Updates room details. Admin only.

id - should be UUID. (Room id)

``` json
{
    "type": enum,  // allowed values - single, double, suite
    "price": string
}

 ```

Delete a room. Admin only.

id - should be UUID. (Room id)
Get all the admins available in the application.
Get all the users available in the application.

item.description: Admin Only api routes. Requires admin token.

item.name: Auth Routes

request.description:
Creates a new user account. This is a public endpoint and does not require authentication.

``` json
{
    "name": string,
    "email": string,
    "password": string  // Min length - 6 (1 upper, 1 lower, 1 special, 1 numeric character)
}

 ```

Authenticates the user and generates both access and refresh tokens.

``` json
{
    "email": string,
    "password": string  // Min length - 6 (1 upper, 1 lower, 1 special, 1 numeric character)
}

 ```
Logs out the authenticated user by invalidating their refresh token.

header.value: accessToken=; Path=/; Expires=Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT; HttpOnly
refreshToken=; Path=/; Expires=Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT; HttpOnly

request.description: Refresh expired access token using the refresh token.

item.description: Authentication routes for user/admin register, login, logout and refreshing access and refresh tokens.

item.name: User Routes

request.description: Returns details of the currently authenticated user.

Updates the profile details of the authenticated user.

``` json
{
    "name": string,       // Optional
    "password": string    // Optional, Min length - 6 (1 upper, 1 lower, 1 special, 1 numeric character)
}

 ```
Fetch list of all hotels. Public route available for all users.

response.name: Success with Query
response.body:
{
    "statusCode": 200,
    "data": {

                "rooms": [
                    {
                        "id": "405b44b0-b158-4363-a8a5-94bb116ddec6",
                        "hotel_id": "133146fd-bb41-48e5-8d9b-54d72afb8851",

                        "type": "double",
                        "price": "5000",
                        "is_available": false,

                    },
                    {
                        "id": "7d0e5759-aa87-47c2-9f7c-75f6a2560b89",
                        "hotel_id": "133146fd-bb41-48e5-8d9b-54d72afb8851",

                        "type": "suite",

                        "is_available": false,

                ]
            },
            {
                "id": "bcea4aab-9587-46ac-807e-785373327d36",

                "location": "Nashik",

response.name: Successful All Queries

request.description:
Returns details of a specific room belonging to a specific hotel.

id - should be UUID. (Room id)

response.name: Successful
response.body:
{
    "statusCode": 200,
    "data": {
        "id": "7d0e5759-aa87-47c2-9f7c-75f6a2560b89",

}

request.description:
Returns all rooms belonging to a specific hotel.

id - should be UUID. (Hotel id)

Returns all rooms belonging to a specific hotel.

id - should be UUID. (Hotel id)

Create a hotel room booking. User must be logged in.

``` json
{
    "room_id": string, (UUID)
    "check_in": date string,
    "check_out": date,
    "status": enum - string     // payment status [pending, completed, refunded]
}

 ```

Cancel a user's existing booking.

id - should be UUID. (Booking id)

``` json
{
    "room_id": string,  // UUID
    "check_in": date string,
    "check_out": date string,
    "status": enum (string)     // payment status [pending, completed, refunded]
}

 ```

item.description: Consists all the user facing apis which the client application interacts with while interacting with the application.
